head.title: Sales Increase at Toymax But Earnings Stay Weak

hedline.hl1: Sales Increase at Toymax But Earnings Stay Weak

abstract.p: Toymax International Inc, citing recent acquisitions reports record first-quarter sales of $25.1 million and operating profit of $67,000 (S)

block.p: Toymax International Inc. of Plainview (Nasdaq: TMAX) reported record first-quarter sales of $25.1 million, attributing the growth mainly to its acquisition of several businesses earlier this year.
The company increased operating income to show a profit of $67,000, compared to a loss in last year's comparable quarter of $701,000. Net loss fell to 2 cents a share, from 3 cents a year earlier.
Toymax International Inc. of Plainview (Nasdaq: TMAX) reported record first-quarter sales of $25.1 million, attributing the growth mainly to its acquisition of several businesses earlier this year.
The company increased operating income to show a profit of $67,000, compared to a loss in last year's comparable quarter of $701,000. Net loss fell to 2 cents a share, from 3 cents a year earlier.
The rise in sales came largely from the acquisition of Monogram International and the Funnoodle product line. These gains were partly offset by a decline in the promotional toy business.
The net loss was attributed in part to a joint venture with Yaboom Ltd., which makes entertainment-based toys and electronics.
